intro: Radermachera boniana, commonly known as the Japanese evergreen maple, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that turn vibrant red in the fall. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, followed by orange-red berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained, fertile soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
